title: I'd Rather, Had Better, I Wish

questions.question: I would rather you ........................... on Monday.
questions.description: After would rather we use a past tense to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: I'd rather you .................................. fight with me in public.
questions.description: After would rather we use a past tense to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: You'd better ............................. now before he gets angry.
questions.description: After had better we use the infinitive without to.

questions.question: I 'd rather you ............................. me with the housework.
questions.description: After would rather we use a past tense to refer to the present or future.

questions.question: You'd better .................................. smoking.
questions.description: After had better we use the infinitive without to.

questions.question: We'd better ................................... seats.
questions.description: After had better we use the infinitive without to.

questions.question: I wish I ............................... there when they arrived.
questions.description: We use a past perfect tense after wish to talk about the past.

questions.question: I wish I ............................... like that.
questions.description: We use a past perfect tense after wish to talk about the past.

questions.question: I wish I .................................. out of school at
questions.description: We use a past perfect tense after wish to talk about the past.

questions.question: I wish I ................................... handsome.
questions.description: We use a past tense after I wish with present or future meaning.

questions.question: I wish that it ………………………….. stop raining soon.
questions.description: We use a past tense after I wish with present or future meaning.

questions.question: I wish dad ……………………… come soon.
questions.description: We use would after wish to express our impatience or dissatisfaction with something.
